intro: Bassovia cornuta, commonly known as the horned bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tubular, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its most notable feature is the elongated, horn-like structure at the base of the flower, which gives it its common name. Bassovia cornuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant colors and unique floral morphology.
